snippet: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s administration says the increase in bike ridership has heightened drivers’ awareness of cyclists and affected their behavior.
abstract: New York City Transportation Dept reports that city's bike-share program riders has logged more than five months and five million trips without a single fatality and only about two dozen reported injuries, most of them minor; Bloomberg administration officials contend that increase in bike ridership has heightened drivers’ awareness of cyclists and improved safety.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s administration says the increase in bike ridership has heightened drivers’ awareness of cyclists and affected their behavior.

headline.main: No Riders Killed in First 5 Months of New York City Bike-Share Program
headline.print_headline: Despite Fears, No Riders Were Killed in First 5 Months of Bike-Share Program
